title: Non si fermano all' alt e sparano sui militatri | carabiniere ucciso a Brindisi
text:
Non si fermano all' alt e sparano sui militatri | carabiniere ucciso a Brindisi
Un grave episodio scuote Brindisi: due uomini sparano contro i militari, uccidendo un carabiniere durante un inseguimento. Le prime ricostruzioni indicano che l'agente stava seguendo un'auto sospetta quando ÃƒÂ¨ stato colpito brutalmente. La comunitÃƒ ÃƒÂ¨ sconvolta di fronte a questa violenza inaudita, e le forze dellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ordine sono impegnate nelle indagini per catturare gli aggressori. La sicurezza del nostro Paese non puÃƒÂ² tollerare simili atti di ferocia.
Stando alle prime ricostruzioni il carabiniere pare stesse seguendo un'auto. Due uomini sarebbero poi scesi e avrebbero aperto il fuoco, freddando il militare.
[ðŸ”— Leggi su Ilgiornale.it]
In questa notizia si parla di: carabiniere - fermano - sparano - militatri
Brindisi, non si fermano allÃ¢â‚¬â„¢alt: carabiniere morto in seguito a sparatoria - La tragedia scuote Brindisi: un carabiniere ha perso la vita e un altro ÃƒÂ¨ rimasto ferito in una sparatoria avvenuta questa mattina sulla strada Francavilla-Grottaglie.
Non si fermano all'alt e sparano sui militatri:
carabiniere ucciso a Brindisi; Non si fermano al posto di blocco e sparano ai Carabinieri: due ricercati a Bari; Grosseto: carabinieri sparano a furgone con rame rubato, autista in fuga. author: /author/ians/
title: 'Made in India' Galaxy Fold7 gain significant traction from tier 4 cities and beyond: Samsung
text:
â€˜Made in Indiaâ€™ Galaxy Fold7 gain significant traction from tier 4 cities and beyond: Samsung
By IANS | Updated: July 31, 2025 09:44 IST2025-07-31T09:37:14+5:302025-07-31T09:44:45+5:30
New Delhi, July 31 Samsung India on Thursday said that its newly-launched, â€˜Made in Indiaâ€™ Galaxy Z Fold7, ...
New Delhi, July 31 Samsung India on Thursday said that its newly-launched, â€˜Made in Indiaâ€™ Galaxy Z Fold7, is surprisingly gaining significant traction from not only tier 3 markets, but also tier 4 and beyond, amid a resilient economy and rising aspirations across the country.
â€œThe unprecedented demand has made us allocate stocks of the Galaxy Z Fold7 across the deeper pockets of Bharat. We are immensely encouraged by the new demand surfacing from tier 4 and beyond and will continue to serve these markets in the best possible manner,â€ said Raju Pullan, Senior Vice President and Head at Samsung India.
Primarily, the design aesthetics of the new Galaxy Z Fold7 â€“ in a sleek, lightweight form factor â€“ have drawn significant interest. The new colours, flagship processing power, along with Galaxy AI have further sweetened the experience for consumers, he added.
The company said it is witnessing unprecedented demand for the Galaxy Z Fold7, with the smartphone being â€˜out-of-stockâ€™ in select markets across the country.
The company is taking necessary steps at its manufacturing factory in Noida to meet the unprecedented demand.
Samsung India had earlier announced that it has received a record 210,000 pre-orders for its seventh generation foldables - Galaxy Z Fold7, Galaxy ZFlip7 and Galaxy Z Flip7 FE â€“ in just 48 hours in India - signalling rapid mainstreaming of the foldable form factor in India.
â€œWe are working overtime to ensure adequate supplies of our most advanced smartphone, to enable customers to enjoy the Galaxy Z Fold7 at the earliest. The strong demand is coming from both retail markets and online platforms,â€ said Pullan.
Galaxy Z Fold7, in its thinnest and lightest design to date, weighs just 215 grams - even lighter than Galaxy S25 Ultra. It is just 8.9 mm thick when folded and 4.2 mm thick when unfolded, according to the company.
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

title: Slow Website Loading Speeds with BT Broadband
text:
on 09-01-2025 8h42
Hi everyone,
Iâ€™m experiencing an issue with my website when accessing it through BT Broadband. The website is hosted on a third-party server and typically loads fine on other ISPs and even on mobile data. However, when I access it via BT Broadband, the loading times are noticeably slower, especially for media-rich pages.
Iâ€™ve already:
Could there be some routing issue specific to BT's network? Would enabling BT Web Protect or Smart Setup affect the connection to my site? Has anyone faced similar issues or have any suggestions?
Thanks in advance for your help!
